This
On
Week
List
Fiction
THE ENGLISH PATIENT, by Michael Ondaatje. (Vintage, $12.) Four damaged people are left behind in a Tuscan villa at the end of World War II.
THE HORSE WHISPERER, by Nicholas Evans. (Dell, $7.50.) A woman seeks solace for herself, her daughter and their horse from a wrangler.
THE CRY OF THE HALIDON, by Robert Ludlum. (Bantam, $7.50.) A man undertakes a potentially dangerous geological survey in Jamaica.
HIDE AND SEEK, by James Patterson. (Warner, $6.99.) A pop music star who killed her first husband is on trial for murdering her second.
SHOCK WAVE, by Clive Cussler. (Pocket, $7.99.) Dirk Pitt contends with a ruthless man whose diamond-mining operations threaten human life.
THE HUNDRED SECRET SENSES, by Amy Tan. (Ivy/Ballantine, $6.99.) The story of a Chinese-American woman and her Chinese half sister.
SONG OF SOLOMON, by Toni Morrison. (Plume/Penguin, $11.95.) A black man's search for his family's history.
LOVE ME FOREVER, by Johanna Lindsey. (Avon, $6.99.) Matchmaking for money and for love in 19th-century England and Scotland.
SILENT NIGHT, by Mary Higgins Clark. (Pocket, $5.99.) A family finds adversity and renewed courage during a Christmas visit to New York.
THE BOOK OF RUTH, by Jane Hamilton. (Anchor/Doubleday, $11.95.) Domestic violence rips apart a young woman's life in a tiny Illinois town.
SNOW FALLING ON CEDARS, by David Guterson. (Vintage, $12.) A murder trial recalls the wartime internment of Japanese-Americans. (+)
THE LOST WORLD, by Michael Crichton. (Ballantine, $7.99.) Scientists visit a Costa Rican jungle that is the breeding ground of dinosaurs.
INTENSITY, by Dean Koontz. (Ballantine, $7.99.) A young woman contends with a serial killer.
THE FOOL'S RUN, by John Sandford. (Berkley, $6.99.) A computer whiz and a thief are hired by a corporation to destroy its rival through sabotage.
ABSOLUTE POWER, by David Baldacci. (Warner, $7.50.) Intrigue and murder in Washington.
LOVE IN ANOTHER TOWN, by Barbara Taylor Bradford. (Harper Paperbacks, $5.99.) A middle-aged woman, deserted by her husband, finds a new career and romance.

This
On
Week
List
NonFiction
A CIVIL ACTION, by Jonathan Harr. (Vintage, $13.) A lawsuit brought by Massachusetts householders against industrial polluters. (+)
SLEEPERS, by Lorenzo Carcaterra. (Ballantine, $6.99.) The true story, the narrator claims, of boys in a reformatory and the revenge they later take.
THE ROAD AHEAD, by Bill Gates with Nathan Myhrvold and Peter Rinearson. (Penguin, $15.95.) What's ahead on the information highway.
LONGITUDE, by Dava Sobel. (Penguin, $10.95.) The story of John Harrison, the 18th-century Englishman who invented the chronometer.
REVIVING OPHELIA, by Mary Pipher. (Ballantine, $12.50.) The dangers for teen-age girls. (+)
HOW THE IRISH SAVED CIVILIZATION, by Thomas Cahill. (Anchor/Doubleday, $12.95.) The story of monks who copied Western literature. (+)
HIGH TIDE IN TUCSON, by Barbara Kingsolver. (Harper Perennial, $12.50.) Essays about motherhood, nature and other topics by the novelist.
THE REAL WORLD DIARIES. (MTV/Melcher Media/Pocket, $18.) Behind the scenes at the television show ''The Real World.''
RUSH LIMBAUGH IS A BIG FAT IDIOT, by Al Franken. (Island/Dell, $6.99.) A television comedian's comments on the political scene.
THE LIARS' CLUB, by Mary Karr. (Penguin, $11.95.) A poet recalls her troubled childhood. (+)
MISS AMERICA, by Howard Stern. (Regan Books/Harper Paperbacks, $7.99.) Anecdotes and fulminations from the radio talk show host.
EMBRACED BY THE LIGHT, by Betty J. Eadie with Curtis Taylor. (Bantam, $5.99.) A woman's near-death experience. (+)
AMAZING GRACE, by Jonathan Kozol. (Harper Perennial, $13.50.) Life as experienced by children in the South Bronx. (+)
DAVID BRINKLEY, by David Brinkley. (Ballantine, $12.) From a boyhood in North Carolina through five decades as a newscaster. (+)
MARINE, by Tom Clancy. (Berkley, $16.) An account of a United States Marine Corps unit. (+)
CARE OF THE SOUL, by Thomas Moore. (Harper Perennial, $12.) Spirituality and daily life. (+)
THE ROAD LESS TRAVELED, by M. Scott Peck. (Touchstone/S&S, $12.) Inspiration. (+)

Advice, How-To and Miscellaneous
THE RULES, by Ellen Fein and Sherrie Schneider. (Warner, $5.99.) The authors offer ''secrets for capturing the heart of Mr. Right.'' (+)
CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE WOMAN'S SOUL, compiled by Jack Canfield, Mark Victor Hansen, Jennifer Read Hawthorne and Marci Shimoff. (Health Communications, $12.95.) Inspiration. (+)
IT'S A MAGICAL WORLD, by Bill Watterson. (Andrews & McMeel, $14.95.) A new collection of ''Calvin and Hobbes'' cartoons.
CHICKEN SOUP FOR THE SOUL, compiled by Jack Canfield and Mark Victor Hansen. (Health Communications, $12.95.) Stories meant to ''open the heart and rekindle the spirit.'' (+)

Rankings reflect sales figures, for the week ending Nov. 30, at 3,985 bookstores plus wholesalers serving 60,000 other retailers, statistically weighted to represent sales in all such outlets nationwide. An asterisk (*) indicates that a book's sales are barely distinguishable from those of the book above. A dagger (+) indicates that some bookstores report receiving bulk orders for a book.
